text: Ronald Johnson Ferrier (26 April 1914 – 11 October 1991) was an English footballer who played in the Football League for Manchester United in the 1930s, and later for and Oldham Athletic. He played for Plymouth Argyle as a wartime guest, and also represented Grimsby Town and Lincoln City before retiring as a player in 1947. He also played/ and scored once as a guest player for Mossley in the 1939–40 season whilst stationed with the army at Ladysmith Barracks.http://www.mossleyweb.com/PlayersAZ/AZF.htm He died in October 1991 at the age of 77. He could play at centre and inside forward. ==References== ==External links== *MUFCInfo.com profile Category:1914 births Category:1991 deaths Category:People from Cleethorpes Category:English footballers Category:Association football forwards Category:Grimsby Town F.C. players Category:Manchester United F.C. players Category:Oldham Athletic A.F.C. players Category:Plymouth Argyle F.C. wartime guest players Category:Lincoln City F.C. players Category:English Football League players Category:Mossley A.F.C. players
title: Ron Ferrier
